summary: Diff largely implements a Vercel-inspired UI refresh via updated global tokens (index.css), refined Tailwind theme, and consistent section shells/cards/header/footer styling while preserving single-page section composition and smooth scrolling behavior. One potentially unrelated addition is a new CTA email capture form handler and an added placeholder hook file summary not requested in the BuildRequest.

hallucinated_features.description: CTA section implements an email submission form with React state and a submit handler that logs the email (email capture behavior), which could be considered an added product feature beyond visual/UX restyling.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly constrains the work to a visual/UX restyle and says not to introduce unrelated product features; adding form submission behavior is not described in REQ-6/REQ-7.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced/mentioned an empty placeholder hook file for future React Query usage.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-6/REQ-7; it relates to future backend functionality rather than UI restyling.
